update.description:
dartsim: add prefix 'modelName/' to child BodyNode before calling moveTo in Attach*Joint, then try to restore BodyNode to its original skeleton if / is detected in child BodyNode's name during DetachJoint

This is a quick hack, but it may help with the self-collide problems observed in [ign-gazebo PR 440](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/440/wip-detachable-joint-system/diff).
update.title: DetachJoint: try to restore BodyNodes to original skeleton

content.html:
Alternatively, we can get the skeleton of the joint and then look up the world of the skeleton from models.

    const std::size_t modelID = this->models.IdentityOf(freeJoint->getSkeleton());
    const std::size_t worldID = this->models.idToContainerID.at(modelID);
    auto dartWorld = this->worlds.at(worldID);

content.raw: Since "/" is not a reserved character, we can assume that a link could have a "/" in its name. If we tried to detach a joint that was created during initial construction of a model (i.e, without calling `AttachFixedJoint`), then it would incorrectly try to modify the name a link. Is there a way we can limit this name modification to joints that were attached by calling `AttachFixedJoint`?
content.html: Since "/" is not a reserved character, we can assume that a link could have a "/" in its name. If we tried to detach a joint that was created during initial construction of a model (i.e, without calling AttachFixedJoint), then it would incorrectly try to modify the name a link. Is there a way we can limit this name modification to joints that were attached by calling AttachFixedJoint?

content.raw: Yeah, I think so. I'll review it.

pullrequest.title: DetachJoint: try to restore BodyNodes to original skeleton

content.raw:
The name should be getting removed from the name manager [here](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/blob/07fd1a15a9dfd16d71903baea7ed515a7106924d/dart/dynamics/Skeleton.cpp#L2386).

The call stack should look something like this:

* [Inside Skeleton::moveBodyNodeTree](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/blob/07fd1a15a9dfd16d71903baea7ed515a7106924d/dart/dynamics/Skeleton.cpp#L2628)
* [Inside Skeleton::extractBodyNodeTree](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/blob/07fd1a15a9dfd16d71903baea7ed515a7106924d/dart/dynamics/Skeleton.cpp#L2742)
* [Inside Skeleton::unregisterBodyNode](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/blob/07fd1a15a9dfd16d71903baea7ed515a7106924d/dart/dynamics/Skeleton.cpp#L2386)

If this is really happening when there’s no BodyNode named `”body”` in the Skeleton, then that would indicate there’s a bug somewhere in DART.
content.html:
The name should be getting removed from the name manager here.

The call stack should look something like this:

  • Inside Skeleton::moveBodyNodeTree
  • Inside Skeleton::extractBodyNodeTree
  • Inside Skeleton::unregisterBodyNode

If this is really happening when there’s no BodyNode named ”body” in the Skeleton, then that would indicate there’s a bug somewhere in DART.

pull_request.title: DetachJoint: try to restore BodyNodes to original skeleton

pullrequest.title: DetachJoint: try to restore BodyNodes to original skeleton

content.raw:
the following might be a bug in dart:

when re-attaching to the skeleton a child originally came from, the [dart::common::NameManager](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/blob/master/dart/common/NameManager.hpp) seems to think the skeleton already has a BodyNode of that name (see console output of `UNIT_JointFeatures_TEST`

~~~
Msg [NameManager::issueNewName] (Skeleton::BodyNode | M1) The name [body] is a duplicate, so it has been renamed to [body(1)]
~~~

perhaps [dart::dynamics::Skeleton::moveBodyNodeTree](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/blob/master/dart/dynamics/Skeleton.cpp#L2547) should update the old Skeleton's NameManager so it knows those BodyNode's are no longer in that Skeleton?
content.html:
the following might be a bug in dart:

when re-attaching to the skeleton a child originally came from, the dart::common::NameManager seems to think the skeleton already has a BodyNode of that name (see console output of UNIT_JointFeatures_TEST

Msg [NameManager::issueNewName] (Skeleton::BodyNode | M1) The name [body] is a duplicate, so it has been renamed to [body(1)]

perhaps dart::dynamics::Skeleton::moveBodyNodeTree should update the old Skeleton's NameManager so it knows those BodyNode's are no longer in that Skeleton?
